snippet: The tobacco industry largely hid evidence of the addictiveness of tobacco, while Exxon published peer-reviewed climate change research even as it raised doubts on the underlying science.
abstract: New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman's investigation of Exxon Mobil over whether it lied to public and investors about risks of climate change raises questions about possible similarities to Justice Dept's successful suit against tobacco companies in 1997.
lead_paragraph: The tobacco industry largely hid evidence of the addictiveness of tobacco, while Exxon published peer-reviewed climate change research even as it raised doubts on the underlying science.

headline.main: Exxon Inquiry Both Mirrors and Contrasts With Tobacco Industry Case
